Most Illustrious Sir

Insuperable inconveniences have delayed our operations in Rio Grande, and the occupation of the capital by the insurgents, depriving us of the resources that came to us from there by mouth and war, has greatly saddened the patriots, to see in the armed citizens a suffering beyond expectation, which may be limited if circumstances do not promptly improve.

The apologists of the opposing party have opened their treasures for their followers, who lack nothing, and this disproportion will be sufficient to change the face of our affairs in a moment. Such considerations forced Your Excellency Sir Your Honor one thousand five hundred patacões, which I do by this present, as I cannot neglect another matter of equal importance; assuring Your Honor

By the bearer, the Sir, Your Honor will send

God keep Your Honor Pelotas, July 22, 1836. Most Illustrious Sir Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães. Domingos José de Almeida Colonel Chief of Legion.

Public Service. Most Illustrious Sir Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães. From the Colonel Chief of the Legion of the District of Rio Grande.
